# tintColor

**Instance Property**

The tint color to apply to the button title and image.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var tintColor: UIColor! { get set }
```

## Discussion

All subclasses of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] derive their behavior for [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/tintColor] from the base class. See the discussion of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/tintColor] at the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] level for more information.

This property has no default effect for buttons with type [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton/ButtonType-swift.enum/custom]. For custom buttons, you must implement any behavior related to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton/tintColor] yourself.

## Managing images and tint color

- **backgroundImage(for:)**: Returns the background image used for a button state.
- **image(for:)**: Returns the image used for a button state.
- **setBackgroundImage(_:for:)**: Sets the background image to use for the specified button state.
- **setImage(_:for:)**: Sets the image to use for the specified state.
- **preferredSymbolConfigurationForImage(in:)**: Returns the preferred symbol configuration for a button state.
- **setPreferredSymbolConfiguration(_:forImageIn:)**: Sets the preferred symbol configuration for a button state.
